definition: lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people

sentences.english: Others had been before him-indeed he had a curious sense of companionship.
sentences.chinese: 對於先輩們，他生起一種殊遇之情。

sentences.english: The number of ancestors patriots, fearless express feat legacy remain merit.
sentences.chinese: 多少先輩志士，無畏抒壯舉，青史留功績。

sentences.english: We inherit the glorious tradition of revolutionary predecessors.
sentences.chinese: 繼承革命先輩的光榮傳統。

sentences.english: The monuments of men's ancestors were the most impressive exhortations.
sentences.chinese: 先輩們的豐碑最能奮勉人心的。

sentences.english: Thirty-four years ago today, the forerunners of our two countries started the diplomatic relations between China and the Philippines.
sentences.chinese: 34年前的今天，我們的先輩們開啓了中菲外交關係。

sentences.english: Like their ancestors, women winnow grain by hand near Lake Titicaca.
sentences.chinese: 和先輩一樣，提提卡卡湖附近的女性還是用手揚穀子。

sentences.english: The box with the ancestors' ashes was emplaced on the top shelf of the house altar.
sentences.chinese: 先輩們的骨灰盒被安放在室內聖壇的最高一層架子上。

sentences.english: We must stand with our fathers.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須和先輩們站在一起。

sentences.english: Without the indomitable will of the revolutionaries, our happy life would be impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在的幸福生活都是革命先輩的鐵血換來的。

sentences.english: On the walls were the pictures of the Baskervilles of the past.
sentences.chinese: 牆上是巴斯克維爾家族的先輩們的畫像。

definition: to keep a record of events/record/to start to form memories (after one's infancy)
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
cap badge (official sign of rank in Qing dynasty)
to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
unit of area equal to 100 畝|亩[mu3] or 6.67 hectares/a short while/a little while ago/circa. (for approximate dates)
section chief (of an administrative unit)/head (of a department)
variant of 聯絡|联络[lian2 luo4]
